page.title: 16WILD PLANTS OF TILMANSTONE
page.content: In 1985 a survey of the area listed some 84{wild flowers.}Some are wide_ spread in England, eg:{cow parsley, {ragged robin, great willow herb, dead {nettles, old mans beard, honeysuckle. Others are more confined to chalk downs and open farmland, eg:{great {field poppy, the campions, orchids, {broomrape, scabious.}Plants from farm_ land have established as wild plants, eg: certain{clovers, vetches, oil seed {rape. {Wild plants}were used extensively in earlier times for{medicines, table use or{cosmetics.}The art of using wild plants has lapsed, but there is now more interest in{natural remedies. Changes in{farming methods}affect the wild plant population. Some have increased, many decreased. Landowners have been made more aware of the need for the{conservation}of wild plants.
